intro: Senecio fluviatilis subsp. sarracenicus, commonly known as the river senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found near water sources such as rivers and streams. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ornamental value. The subspecies sarracenicus is distinguished by its unique leaf shape and floral structure compared to other members of the species.
